name: GetTimeTrackingTimeTypes
description:
Retrieve nested prompt structure for Time Tracking Time Types.

Use this tool to obtain a structured prompt for Time Tracking Time Types, mirroring the layout used in UI prompts. Note that this does not include Time Offs.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date for the time period the worker is creating a time entry for. Format expected: YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: End date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

parameters.name: maximum_response_objects
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of time types to return in the response. Maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: response_start_index
parameters.description: Zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. Defaults to 0. Use with 'limit' for paging.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: start_date_for_time_entry
parameters.description: Start date for the worker's time entry period. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: Start date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

parameters.name: worker_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the worker for whom the Time Type data is needed.

value_schema.description: Worker for which Time Type is needed.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

value_schema.description: End date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

value_schema.description: Start date of the time period the worker is creating a time entry for.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: Worker for which Time Type is needed.

value_schema.description: Worker for which Time Type is needed.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
